translation.en: [man 1] Only barbarians drink unmixed wine.
Out of my way, bastard.
Self-control is of the essence.
How much for ore today?
Two drachmas for the lot of it.
Two drachmas? That's it?
Be grateful I do business with you at all.
How did it go?
[woman] What about the rest of it?
I was lucky to get that.
Don't worry. We'll figure something out.
What's going on?
You need not fear me.
I am Grand Archon Alexia.
I'm in pursuit of a demon. Have you seen anything pass?
translation.ko: 악마를 쫓고 있지 뭔가 지나가는 걸 봤나?

translation.en: -Demon? No. -Then get inside.
These monsters know no mercy.
Old fool, what are you doing?
Breaking my leg. What's it look like? [groans]
You've drunk more than you've bled, you old goat.
One of these days, you're gonna get yourself killed, Elias.
Go ahead without me.
You're old, not dead.
translation.ko: 나이 든 거지 죽은 게 아니잖아요

translation.en: We have to clean this.
Heron?
Are you injured?
[man] Get to safety.
Arrest this man.
The rumors are true.
An army from the east descends upon us.
But this enemy is unlike anything we've ever seen before.
They're a cult of monsters many dare not speak of.
translation.ko: 감히 입 밖에도 못 꺼낼 괴물 집단이지

translation.en: -[man] Monsters? -Did she say monsters?
[Alexia] Only after I saw them did I finally believe.
And now, so will you.
Let this test of fire reveal your true nature.
translation.ko: 뭘 하려는 거지? 이 불로 네 실체가 드러나리니

translation.en: [grunting] No! No. Please, please!
No, no!
-What are you doing? -May the gods have mercy.
translation.ko: - 뭐지? - 뭐 하는 겁니까? 신들이 자비를 베푸시기를

translation.en: You will convert or die.
By the gods…
You and your cult have forsaken man and spilled innocent blood.
translation.ko: 너희 족속은 인간을 저버리고 무고한 피를 흘렸다

translation.en: We've forsaken nothing.
We are the strong and you are the--
How is this possible?
How can something like that live inside someone?
translation.ko: 어떻게 그런 존재가 사람 속에 살죠?

translation.en: To understand demons…
you must to back to the great war against the giants.
Giants? When the world was new…
[Elias] …the gods, the masters of light,
defeated the titans, the family of darkness.
But as the last titan fell,
he swore a curse on the gods. And when his blood struck the sea…
translation.ko: 신들에게 저주를 퍼부었다 티탄의 피가 바다에 닿자…

translation.en: The giants were born.
These monsters were brought into the world for a single purpose.
translation.ko: 이 괴물들은 하나의 목적을 갖고 세상에 태어났다

translation.en: To destroy the realm of the gods.
The hellish war erupted, for the great Gigantomachy had begun.
translation.ko: 지옥 같은 전쟁이 일어났어 거인족과 신들의 싸움이 시작됐지

translation.en: The gods swore to defeat the giants and rid them from the earth.
translation.ko: 신들은 거인족을 물리치고 이 땅에서 없애겠다고 맹세했다

translation.en: Both gods and giants fell alike.
Still, neither side would relent,
and the two factions battled on endlessly, incapable of conquering the other.
translation.ko: 승부가 나지 않는 전투가 끝없이 이어졌다

translation.en: Until one day,
Zeus convinced two of the giants to take up arms with the gods.
translation.ko: 제우스가 신들의 편에 서라고 두 거인을 설득했어

translation.en: And with this, reason and compromise were introduced to the world.
Soon, Zeus would lead one final attack.
[Elias] Zeus ordered Hermes to gather their souls…
translation.ko: 제우스는 헤르메스한테 그들의 영혼을 모으라고 했어

translation.en: while their remains were cast into the ocean,
to be forever swallowed… by the tides.
The smithing god Hephaestus forged the grand automaton Talos
translation.ko: 대장장이 신 헤파이스토스가 청동 거인 탈로스를 만들어

translation.en: to stand guard over the cauldron,
forever sworn to keep it shut so that this evil would never return.
translation.ko: 사악한 존재가 돌아오지 못하게 영원히 지키겠다고 맹세했지

translation.en: What does this have to do with demons?
Patience, my young friend.
As the ages passed, a terrible squall rustled the ocean floor,
translation.ko: 시간이 흐르며 지독한 돌풍이 해저를 휩쓸었고

translation.en: casting a dead giant ashore.
And as the fates would have it,
one of these dark vessels was discovered by a man.
And though he did not know it, this evil began poisoning him.
translation.ko: 그 남자는 자기도 모르는 새에 악에 오염되기 시작했어

translation.en: For to even touch a giant is to feel the abyss.
translation.ko: 거인을 건드리기만 해도 심연을 느낄 수 있었지

translation.en: And as the moth is drawn to the flame, so were others drawn to him.
These men ceased to pay tribute to the gods.
Instead, they pledged their allegiance to the giants.
And soon, they began to eat of the giant.
Through this black communion a new family of darkness arose.
translation.ko: 이 암흑의 교감으로 새로운 종족이 탄생했어

translation.en: They became demons.
Evil and wicked creatures hidden beneath a human veneer.
translation.ko: 인간의 껍데기 아래 숨은 사악한 존재지

translation.en: Why would the gods allow this?
Because adversity is what makes man great.
We'd be weak and useless if the gods were always swooping in
translation.ko: 신들이 항상 개입해 문제를 해결하면 인간은 나약하고 쓸모없어져

translation.en: and solving our problems.
Huh, I almost forgot.
Please, accept this as a small token of my appreciation.
translation.ko: 이걸 내 감사의 표시로 받아 주게나

translation.en: But it comes with one condition. You make us your wonderful stew.
translation.ko: 하지만 조건이 하나 있네 맛있는 스튜를 만들어 줘야 해

translation.en: [woman] I don't know what we'd do without you.
translation.ko: 어르신 안 계시면 우린 어떻게 살까요?

translation.en: -Must be from Hades. -Strange.
-God help us all. -Gods help us all.
What's your name?
Ah, Heron.
You fought bravely last night.
And thanks to you, Heron, we found a map, one that describes a nearby encampment.
translation.ko: 네 덕에 지도를 찾았어 근처 야영지가 표시돼 있지

translation.en: One the demons will most certainly use to stage their attack.
Join us. Help us take the fight to them.
It's the best way to protect this polis.
I'm sorry, my lady.
Alexia.
I'm sorry, Alexia, but these people have forsaken my mother and I.
translation.ko: 알렉시아, 죄송하지만 저와 제 어머니를 배척하는 사람들을 위해

translation.en: Why should I fight for them?
Because all our fates hang in the balance.
Their fate, perhaps. But not mine.
If what she says is true, we should go.
translation.ko: 알렉시아 말이 사실이라면 우린 떠나야 해요

translation.en: You don't understand. We can't.
translation.ko: 넌 이해 못 하겠지만 우린 떠날 수 없어

translation.en: Why?
Heron, it'll be our death.
What are you talking about?
You're no bastard.
-Your father-- -[man 2] There's the whore! I see her.
-[man 3] That old slut. -[man 4] Over there.
We're here to test your whore mother.
translation.ko: 네 헤픈 엄마를 시험해 보러 왔다

translation.en: You touch her with that and I'll end you.
Ever since she's turned up, a cloud has hung over us.
translation.ko: 네 엄마가 나타난 이후로 먹구름이 사라지지 않았어

translation.en: She's one of them.
You can't kill all of us.
No. Just some. Who's first?
translation.ko: 몇 명은 죽이겠죠 누가 먼저 덤빌래요?

translation.en: That's enough!
No!
-Mom! Mom! -[horse neighs]
Rough day.
I would have helped, but there were only ten of them.
translation.ko: 도우려고 했는데 열 명밖에 안 되더군

translation.en: I should have gone with them.
You won't be here forever.
translation.ko: 자네가 여기 영원히 있지는 않을 거야

translation.en: [Elias] Alexia's right. War is upon us. We must prepare.
translation.ko: 알렉시아 말대로 전쟁이 일어날 거야 대비해야 해

translation.en: [Heron] How?
Climb to the top of this mountain.
There, you will find a rose bush that stands out from the others.
translation.ko: 장미 덤불 하나가 눈에 띌 거야

translation.en: If you dig beneath it, you will find the adamantine ore we'll need
translation.ko: 그 아래를 파면 금강석이 나올 거다

translation.en: to make you a sword like no other.
How did you find me…
Ares?
You betray your own bidding, o king of kings.
translation.ko: 스스로 내린 명령을 어겼군요 왕 중의 왕이여

translation.en: I thought we were not to intervene.
Or does that not apply to you?
I simply said we cannot fight for them.
And that I have not done.
Oh, I see.
I'll make that distinction clear to the others.
translation.ko: 다른 신들한테도 그 차이를 분명히 전하죠

translation.en: You'll do no such thing.
Then allow me to help you. No.
translation.ko: - 그럼 저도 돕게 해 주세요 - 안 돼

translation.en: If man is meant to inherit the earth, they must do so on their own accord.
translation.ko: 인간이 이 땅을 받을 운명이라면 노력해서 얻어야 해

translation.en: Then why do you come to this one's aid?
[Ares] Do you really think this bastard can lead them?
translation.ko: 저 사생아가 인류를 이끌 수 있다고 생각해요?

translation.en: I do.
